auto-dump_key2: Yeh `code` `execute` karo. Kya iss `code` ko `execute` karne ke baad `ektha.db` `file` ke contents change honge?
auto-dump_key3: Agar hum chahte hai, ki hamare changes, hamari `file` (yaani Hard Disk mei) **persistently** jaaye, toh hum `dump` function abhi tak call kar rahe the.
auto-dump_key4: Par hum ab kuch aisa karenge, ki bina `dump` function call karein bhi, jaise jaise, hum values set karte jaye, toh woh changes hamari `hard disk` yaani `file` mei bhi write ho jaye.
auto-dump_key6: Humein `load` function (aur accordingly MeraDB Class) ko aise modify karna hai, ki agar second argument `True` ho toh - `file` mei `auto dumping` enable ho jaye.
auto-dump_key7: Iska matlab hai ki, jaise hi koi bhi value `set` ki jaye, toh woh da`tab`ase mei `write` ho jaye.
auto-dump_key8:
Sochiye, agar aap aisa nahi karenge toh kya hoga.
To hum jo bhi `set` operations karenge, jab tak da`tab`ase mei `dump` nahi karenge, `tab` tak hamari `file` mei write nahi honge.
auto-dump_key9: Par `auto dumping` enable karne se, hamara `code` har `set` operation ke baad automatically update kar dega. Par yeh update sirf `tab` hi karega jab `load` ko `True` as an argument milega. Agar usse ya toh
auto-dump_key12: toh `code` pehle ki tarah hi chalega. Yaani agar `dump` function call nahi kiya hoga, toh da`tab`ase mei koi change nahi hoga.
auto-dump_key14: Jab bhi aap ko koi aisa task milta hai, toh aapko poore dhyaan se questions poochne chahiye.
auto-dump_key16: Woh kar ne ke liye koi smaller steps jo humei karne hi padenge?
auto-dump_key17: Jo hum kar rahe hai, uska kya use hai?
auto-dump_key18:
Kya usko kisi behtar tarah se kar sakte hai?
etc.
